newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia names temporary securities official.
newsitem.headline: Australia names temporary securities official.

text.p: The Australian government on Thursday named Joseph Longo as an acting member of the Australian Securities Commission.
Parliamentary secretary to the Treasurer, Ian Campbell, said Longo, the commission's national enforcement director since August 1996, would hold the acting post for six months.

Longo, who previously worked in commercial litigation in Australia and the United States, has also been a consultant to the commission since February 1995, including assisting investigations, Campbell said in a statement.
